events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, involving significant front-end damage to their car.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and insured’s description of the incident.
An agent was assigned to the case to begin the claim assessment process and coordinate next steps with the customer.
The customer received official acknowledgment of their claim with information on the investigation and documentation process.
Requested police report, photos of vehicle damage, and insurance papers from the customer to proceed with the assessment.
Customer provided all requested documents, including photos of the damaged vehicle and the official police collision report.
The insurance company's claims investigator initiated a full review of the accident circumstances and submitted documents.
After thorough review, the investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and extensive vehicle damage was confirmed.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental vehicle expenses was proposed to the customer for approval.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement terms and appreciated the prompt communication from the insurer.
Approval was granted to proceed with the payment as per the agreed settlement for the auto accident claim.
The payment for vehicle repair and associated costs was successfully issued to the customer’s bank account.
The claim was formally closed after all settlement payments were completed and the customer confirmed no further issues.
